On Mon, 28 Feb 2005 14:28:19 -0800, bikefridaywalter
<roulez-libre@animail.net> wrote:
> yeah, i was going through old stuff and trying to
> get rid of things.  i've been trying to avoid
> being a packrat like my mom.  anyways, i threw
> out a ton of pics thinking "oh, yeah this person
> from irc, i'll never see them again."  even
> michaele's picture (i'm sorry, it's true!)  i
> know cindy rizi, ashlee mclaughlin, and sherrie
> nyugen were in that bunch too.  damn damn damn.
> 
> well, hell, i'm really glad to see we're all
> getting back together again.  i still have some
> lasting relationships with folks from irc
> (amadeus who now lives out here and builds wheels
> at the bike manufacturer i work for and rolvow
> who still lives with his parents despite being
> married, having travelled the world, and thinking
> about crossing the atlantic on a tandem kayak)
> and often find myself missing it.  instant
> msg'ing doesn't cut it and no irc has the same
> feel cfn did.
> 
> can someone PLEASE e-mail
> (roulez-libre@animail.net) me a list of the
> people they need/want to get a hold of?  i know a
> few of them on the last list i can take care of.
> i was in contact with shannon blake (shag) a
> while back.  i can probably find her again.
> 
> i really vote for a picnic but let's get the hell
> out of cleveland.  i'm so glad i got out of that
> cesspool it's not even funny!  oregon at least
> starts with an o.  no, olklahoma doesn't count.
> it's technically pronounced "auh-kluh-homey."
> 
> but all seriousness aside, let me catch you all up:
> 
> i am/was walter lapchynski or sasha i nyktos /
> TriXteR, nyghtmeyr, silence, and a bunch of other
> nicks i can't even keep track of / at128 or fv075
> (both respective to my real name and my nomme de
> plume).  i was the guy who (with a little help)
> handcuffed sati and sat on top of her at a picnic
> many moons ago.  HAHAH!!  god i can't believe i'm
> remembering all this shit.
> 
> my story goes a little like this:  i did nothing.
> just acted like the usual freak i still am to
> various degrees until rolvow came back from
> europe and taunted me with good stories.  he made
> me promise i'd go with him next time he went some
> where.  and i did.  we went to san fran to see
> crash worship (who is unfortunately defunkt but
> we saw every year after the 1st time we saw them
> because it was such a religious experience) and i
> fell in love with the west coast.  he got the
> idea of hiking the pacific crest trail and i came
> along with.  we had some hiking partners (one of
> which was his gf) who werent' experienced enuff
> and so we ended up getting off.  we split ways
> and i ended up going to portland oregon where my
> wife was (we had met her along the way which is a
> much longer story full of amazing coincidences)..
> i spent some time homeless, we hooked up, went to
> hawai'i where we bummed around on the beach for
> months on end at punalu'u and got engaged in
> manoa.  then we came back and settled on
> eugene... until my dad offered me a free house in
> cleveland (another long story) which we took but
> living in slavic village was kinda lame.  i spent
> some time starting school (i finally figured out
> what i wanted to do among all the millions of
> things i was interested in) by doing community
> college whilst being a bike messenger downtown.
> by now the bike addiction was rampant, so when we
> returned (i dragged amadeus back who was the guy
> who introduced me to being a messenger there) i
> had to find a job around bikes.  i got lucky as a
> bike manufacturer (www.bikefriday.com) was
> hiring.  i've done a little bit of everything
> here and built a shitload of bikes for myself.
> we were even car free for a bit but our house
> (yes we bought a little fixer uper that's now got
> a brand new house on the property) is kinda too
> far out for my wife and daughter.  so now we have
> a little kia spectra.  i still ride my bike
> everyday.  i'm two (this one and the next) terms
> away from my bachelors in science.  should have
> an honors degree and a dissertation to show for
> it, specifically on a gene (dim-6) involved in
> DNA methylation in Neurospora crassa (french
> bread yeast).  then maybe a job, but prolly grad
> school.  just visited UCLA and applied to a few
> others in cali, hawaii, and uoregon (where i've
> been doing all my gen science and bio studies
> at).  so i dunno what the next step is, but i'm
> having fun and loving life.
> 
> phew.
> 
> i think that's it.
> 
> in other news, dan:  i can't believe you're
> working for the feds.
> 
> we need to get some more people on this list.
> and we all need to hook up on irc again.  i
> wonder if we can still manage to remember what
> cliques we belong in. :)
> 
> w
